title: How to Format a Hard Drive for Use With Xbox 360

steps.title: In this process your hard drive will be formatted, so back up all files to another hard drive, laptop, or be prepared to lose everything on your hard drive.
steps.content: In this process your hard drive will be formatted, so back up all files to another hard drive, laptop, or be prepared to lose everything on your hard drive.

steps.title: After you have backed everything up, plug your hard drive into an Xbox 360 then go 'My Xbox/System Settings/Memory.'
steps.content: After you have backed everything up, plug your hard drive into an Xbox 360 then go 'My Xbox/System Settings/Memory.' If an option called "USB Storage Device" appears, please skip to step 8.

steps.title: (This may only work on Windows 7) Connect the hard drive to your laptop.
steps.content: (This may only work on Windows 7) Connect the hard drive to your laptop. Open up your Start menu, right click on 'My PC' and select 'Manage'

steps.title: Find your external hard drive, right click then select 'Format'
steps.content: Find your external hard drive, right click then select 'Format'

steps.title: Change the File System to 'exFAT' then select 'OK,' then select 'Continue' on the next screen.
steps.content: Change the File System to 'exFAT' then select 'OK,' then select 'Continue' on the next screen.

steps.title: Reconnect your hard drive to your Xbox 360 then go to 'My Xbox/System Settings/Memory.'
steps.content: Reconnect your hard drive to your Xbox 360 then go to 'My Xbox/System Settings/Memory.'

steps.title: Select 'USB Storage Device/Configure Now' then accept the warning.
steps.content: Select 'USB Storage Device/Configure Now' then accept the warning.

steps.title: After the formatting is complete a Performance Warning box will appear, click 'OK.'
steps.content: After the formatting is complete a Performance Warning box will appear, click 'OK.'

steps.title: Now in the 'Storage Devices' screen you should see a new option 'Memory Unit.'
steps.content: Now in the 'Storage Devices' screen you should see a new option 'Memory Unit.' This shows that the formatting was successful.

steps.title: Disconnect your hard drive, then connect it to your laptop, load on some media (makes sure the file types are compatible), then reconnect it to your Xbox 360.
steps.content: Disconnect your hard drive, then connect it to your laptop, load on some media (makes sure the file types are compatible), then reconnect it to your Xbox 360.

steps.title: Your selected media should not appear under 'Portable Device' in the Video/Music/Picture Library.
steps.content: Your selected media should not appear under 'Portable Device' in the Video/Music/Picture Library.
